title: Ticket #562: download-versions should handle old Python more gracefully
description:
Observed behavior on a standard lab-supporter RHEL5 box: 
% download-versions
  File "/p/condor/home/bin/download-versions", line 400
    "enabled" if vrec.Enabled( ) else "disabled",
               ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

The problem, as documented in ReleasePunchList, is that the script assumes Python 2.5.something or later, but the default for RHEL5, as well as /s/python/, is 2.4.x.

Ideally it should Just Work, possibly by hard coding a known good Python path in the #!, using a wrapper script to detect the suitable version, or just limiting itself to constructs that are valid Python 2.4. Failing that, detecting the problem and providing a more useful error message would be nice.
